titlePart.entryReference: counting

titlePart.text: MEASURING LENGTH, THICKNESS, OR SIMILAR LINEAR DIMENSIONS
MEASURING IRREGULARITIES OF SURFACES OR CONTOURS
titlePart.entryReference: measuring human body, see the relevant places, where such exist, e.g. , ,
measuring appliances combined with walking-sticks
sorting according to dimensions
tool-setting or drawing instruments not specially modified for measuring , , ,
combinations of measuring devices with writing-appliances
geodetical, nautical or aeronautical measuring, surveying, rangefinding
photogrammetry
measuring force
investigating particle size, investigating surface area of porous material
using radar, using sonar, using analogous systems employing other waves
geophysical measuring
measuring length or roll diameter of film in cameras or projectors
combinations of measuring devices with means for controlling or regulating
measuring elapsed travel of recording medium in recording and playback equipment, sensing diameter of record in autochange gramophones
means structurally associated with electric rotary current collectors for indicating brush wear
indicating consumption of electrodes in arc lamps

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().

Measuring, by methods of general application, displacements, e.g. of the pointer of a measuring instrument, which are caused by variables of which the measurement is not covered by this sub-class, is dealt with in sub-class .

The groups of this sub-class are distinguished by the means of measurement which is of major importance. Thus the mere application of other means for giving a final indication does not affect the classification.
Machines operated on similar principles to the hand-held devices specified in this sub-class are classified with these devices.

titlePart.text: MEASURING DISTANCES, LEVELS, OR BEARINGS, FOR SURVEYING OR NAVIGATION

titlePart.entryReference: measuring angles or linear dimensions in general
measuring liquid level
measuring intensity or direction of magnetic fields, other than the earth's field, in general
involving the emission and reception of radio waves, other electromagnetic waves or sonic waves
optical systems therefor
maps, globes

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the title of class .
In this sub-class, "navigation" means determining the position and course of land vehicles, ships, aircraft, and space vehicles.

titlePart.text: INDICATING OR RECORDING IN CONNECTION WITH MEASURING IN GENERAL
DEVICES OR INSTRUMENTS FOR MEASURING TWO OR MORE VARIABLES NOT COVERED IN A SINGLE OTHER SUB-CLASS
MEASURING OR TESTING NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
titlePart.entryReference: means structurally associated with lightning or other overvoltage discharging apparatus for recording the operation thereof
displaying information in general
recording in a way which requires playback through a transducer

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().
This sub-class includes:
devices for indicating or recording the results of measurements, not peculiar to variables covered in a single other sub-class;
analogous apparatus but in which the input is not a variable to be measured, e.g. a hand operation;
details of measuring instruments, which are of general interest;
measurement transducers not adapted solely for the measurement of a single specified variable and not provided for elsewhere;
measuring or testing not otherwise provided for.

titlePart.text: MEASURING VOLUME, VOLUME FLOW, MASS FLOW, OR LIQUID LEVEL

titlePart.entryReference: burettes or pipettes
arrangements of liquid volume meters or volume-flow meters in liquid-delivering apparatus, e.g. for retail sale purposes,
pumps, fluid motors, details common to measuring or metering devices and pumps or fluid motors

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().

titlePart.entryReference: sorting by weighing

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().

titlePart.text: MEASUREMENT OF MECHANICAL VIBRATIONS, e.g. OF SOUND WAVES
titlePart.entryReference: generation of mechanical vibrations without measurement , ,
measuring position, direction or velocity of an object ,
transducers per se, see the relevant sub-classes, e.g. , ,
determining unbalance
determining properties of materials by sonic or ultrasonic waves transmitted therethrough
seismology, seismic prospecting, acoustic prospecting
recording vibrations for subsequent reproduction ,
manufacture of electromechanical resonators by processes which include measurement of frequency with consequential modification of the resonator

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().
This sub-class includes the combination of generation and measurement of mechanical vibrations.

titlePart.text: MEASUREMENT OF INTENSITY, VELOCITY, SPECTRAL CONTENT, POLARISATION, OR PHASE OF INFRA-RED, VISIBLE OR ULTRA-VIOLET LIGHT

titlePart.entryReference: light sources , , ,
investigating properties of materials by optical means

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().
This sub-class includes the detection of the presence or absence of infra-red, visible, or ultra-violet light, not otherwise provided for.

titlePart.text: THERMALLY-SENSITIVE ELEMENTS NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
titlePart.entryReference: sensing temperature changes for compensating measurements of other variables or for compensating readings of instruments for variation in temperature, see or relevant sub-class for variable measured
radiation pyrometry
testing or determining physical or chemical properties of materials by measuring temperatures
compound sensitive elements, e.g. bimetallic,

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().
In this sub-class, the word "thermometer" includes thermally-sensitive elements not provided for in other sub-classes.

titlePart.text: MEASURING FORCE, TORQUE, WORK, MECHANICAL POWER, MECHANICAL EFFICIENCY, OR FLUID PRESSURE
titlePart.entryReference: sensing pressure changes for compensating measurements of other variables or for compensating readings of instruments for variations in pressure or relevant sub-class for the variable measured
weighing

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().

titlePart.text: TESTING STATIC OR DYNAMIC BALANCE OF MACHINES OR STRUCTURES
TESTING STRUCTURES OR APPARATUS NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().

titlePart.text: INVESTIGATING CHEMICAL OR PHYSICAL PROPERTIES OF MATERIALS
titlePart.entryReference: apparatus fully provided for in a single other sub-class, see the relevant sub-class, e.g.
separating components of materials in general , , ,
measuring or testing involving enzymes or micro-organisms ,
investigation of foundation soil in situ
sensing humidity changes for compensating measurements of other variables or for compensating readings of instruments for variations in humidity, see or relevant sub-class for variable measured
testing or determining the properties of structures
measuring or investigating electric or magnetic properties of materials
determining sensitivity, graininess, or density of photographic materials
testing component parts of nuclear reactors

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().
In this sub-class, the term "investigating" means testing or determining, and the term "materials" includes solid, liquid, and gaseous media, e.g. the atmosphere.

titlePart.text: MEASURING LINEAR OR ANGULAR SPEED, ACCELERATION, DECELERATION, OR SHOCK
INDICATING PRESENCE, ABSENCE, OR DIRECTION, OF MOVEMENT
titlePart.entryReference: monitoring speed or deceleration of electrically-propelled vehicles
vehicle lighting systems adapted to indicate speed
determining position or course in navigation, measuring ground distance in geodesy or surveying
combined measuring devices for measuring two or more variables of movement
measuring velocity of sound
measuring velocity of light
by reception or emission of radio waves, other electromagnetic waves, or sonic waves, and based on propagation time
measuring speed of nuclear radiation
measuring acceleration of gravity

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().

titlePart.entryReference: measuring physical variables of any kind by conversion into electric variables, see Note (4) following the title of class
measuring diffusion of ions in an electric field, e.g. electrophoresis, electro-osmosis,
investigating non-electric or non-magnetic properties of materials by using electric or magnetic methods
indicating correct tuning of resonant circuits
monitoring electronic pulse counters
monitoring operation of communication systems

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().

This sub-class deals with (a) measuring all kinds of electric and magnetic variables directly or by derivation from other electric or magnetic variables; (b) measuring all kinds of electric and magnetic properties of materials; (c) testing electric and magnetic devices, apparatus, and networks (e.g. discharge tubes, amplifiers) and measuring their characteristics; (d) indicating presence or sign of current or voltage; (e) equipment for generating signals to be used for carrying out such tests and measurements.
The expression "measuring" is used to include investigating.
In this sub-class:
The expression "arrangements for measuring" is used to mean "apparatus, circuits, or methods for measuring".

Electric measuring instruments of the general types dealt with in groups , , but specially adapted for measuring a specific variable, e.g. frequency, phase, impedance, are dealt with in the groups relevant to such variables.
Group takes precedence over groups .

titlePart.text: RADIO DIRECTION-FINDING, LOCATING, DISTANCE OR VELOCITY MEASURING

titlePart.entryReference: for special applications, see the relevant sub-classes, e.g. ,
navigation in general
measuring infrasonic, sonic, or ultrasonic vibrations in general
measuring infra-red, visible, or ultra-violet radiation in general
transducers per se, see the relevant sub-classes, e.g. , ,
measuring electric or magnetic variables in general
detecting masses or objects not involving reflection or reradiation, geophysics
aerials

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title (), and to Note (1) following the title of sub-class .

titlePart.entryReference: radiation analysis of materials, mass spectrometry
counters per se ,
electric discharge tubes for analysing radiation or particles , ,

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().
This sub-class deals with the measurement of X-radiation, gamma radiation, corpuscular radiation, cosmic radiation, or neutron radiation.

titlePart.entryReference: detecting or locating foreign bodies for diagnostic, surgical or person-identification purposes
means for indicating the location of accidentally buried, e.g. snow-buried, persons
measuring chemical or physical properties of earth materials
measuring electric or magnetic variables in general, other than direction or magnitude of the earth's field
radar, sonar or analogous methods , ,

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().
The geophysical methods of this sub-class apply both to the earth and to other celestial objects, e.g. planets.

titlePart.entryReference: influencing weather conditions
dispersing fog
instruments for measuring single variables in general, see the appropriate sub-class of class , e.g. ,
obtaining meteorological information by radar

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().
In this sub-class, the term "meteorology" includes measurement of certain ambient atmospheric conditions.
